intro: Cansjera grossularioides, commonly known as the African snowball, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, spherical clusters of white or pink flowers. The plant produces small, hairy fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens in warm climates. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to bloom throughout the year under optimal conditions.
